result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry James Hiltunen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Larry James Hiltunen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Larry James Hiltunen was found guilty of Aggravated Battery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6).
  • Larry James Hiltunen was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution and court-appointed attorney fees are to be determined.  Financial obligations shall be paid during prison and ES.  If ES is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

**6/12/17**:  Restitution in the amount of $468.65 to the Office of Crime Victims Services and $2,287 to Connie J. was ordered.  Restitution shall be paid through DOC to the Iron County District Attorney's Office for disbursement.

Defendant shall recieve 65 days credit towards Count #1.  

This Court deems defendant eligible for any programs that are now available or that become available in the future to defendant.

Defendant shall contact the Iron County Sheriff's Department at (715) 561-2440 within 10 business days of sentencing to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall also pay the surcharge for same.

Defendant shall have no contact with C.J. (victim).

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant's sentence is deemed served.  (125 days of total credit - 60 days = 65 remaining).

Defendant Larry James Hiltunen in court with attorney Daniel W Johns.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls cases, 15CM53, 15CM15, 16TR22, 12, 110, 109 and 15TR826.    Per DA, dismiss: 16TR22, 16TR112, 110, 16TR109, 15TR827.  Court grants motion.  As to 16CF15, DA amends Count 1 to 941.19(6), FH.  DA to dismiss and read in Counts 2 and 3 and dismiss Count 5.  Court grants motion to dismiss/dismiss read-in.  As to 15CM53,   1,2,3,4,6, dismissed by court.  Count 5 is amended to DCMV.  PLQ filed.  Attorney Johns agrees to disposition of charges and statement of DA.  Has explained rights to defendant.  Def pleads NC to Count 1 and Count 4 in 16CF15.  In 15CM53, Defendant pleads NC to amended charge of DCMV and court imposes 5 days in jail in lieu of fine.  Defendant freely pleads, no coercion.  PLQ reviewed by court.  Admits would give same answers if court individually asked.  Court questions defendant further.  Per Atty Johns, def freely pleads.  Court is satisfied freely pleads and finds quilty of Count 1, 4 and DCMV.  There is joint recommendation.  Court advises def of right of allocution.  Def addresses court.  Court follows recommendation of counsel and sentences as follows:  Defendant is eligible for every program that is now available or that becomes available.  Per Atty Johns, def is not eligible for CIP.  As to Count 1 in 15CF15, court sentences to 3 years P/3 years ES.  Per court, 60 days of jail credit is to be applied to bail jumping (Count #4).  Count #5 in 15CM35, DCMV, is concurrent with Count 4 of 15CF 15, 5 days (no additional jail time.)  Sheriff's Dept. to calculate total credit and provide to clerk.  Defendant shall pay costs of $518 inclusive of DNA sucharge during prison and ES.  Victim restitution is TBD and if necessary, can have a restitution hearing.  No contact with C.J., DNA sample required.  WEDS filled out by court to be sent with defendant.  Defendant is not eligible for CIP. Per court attorney fees to be added to costs when invoice provided.  Court adjourned.  klr
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment

Defendant waives formal reading of the information and pleads not guilty.  Clerk to enter.  Bond continues as established.  PTC to be scheduled in two weeks with trial date to follow.  Dan Johns makes motion to reduce bond.  Count continues motion.  klr
